website_summaries.verdict: A capable personal blender from a top brand in the middle of the price range.
pros: Easy to take on the go without pouring into another container
Can crush ice or blend frozen fruit
Containers are dishwasher safe for easy cleanup
cons: Reports that the motor dies after a bit of use

website_summaries.verdict: Although small and somewhat basic, this is a reliable little blender with automatic programming features. Great for smoothies.
pros: Reliable and capable of blending whole fruits and vegetables with rugged Pro Extractor blades
cons: Loud and has the tendency to vibrate when in operation
At 900 watts, it is less powerful than others we considered

customer_reviews.title: moldy gasket
customer_reviews.text: Major health hazard with this product! There is issue with the gasket. After only few times of using (washing and drying each time) I noticed a smell. I pulled out the gasket (not easy to do) and there is mold on the gasket! Unbelievable! Unacceptable and scary! I used a brush to clean around the blade and the edge. The product design should be revised to allow for cleaning under the gasket.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Useless warranty
customer_reviews.text: When i purchased it was great.. it blends anything in seconds. After 4-5 months it started making a loud noise. And then blender blade stopped working. Since the blender is on warranty period, we asked for blade replacement. And they are asking for $20 as the shipping cost for the blade which is actually the price of the blade if we purchase it separately. So in short no use of warranty.. for a $70 blender i need to pay more $35 to get it working. Just to replace the blade they charge 35 dollars. please dont buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: Ank

customer_reviews.title: Product went bad before one year
customer_reviews.text: Product went bad before one year, bought protection plan, but both Asurion (the company that sells protection plan) and the manufacturer both refused to replace since there is no serial number at the base of the motor and also we didn't receive any protection plan info in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best juicer/blender
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a Nutri bullet-( very weak motor, Constant leaking, hard to open) This Nutri Ninja Pro Silver is super sturdy, lines up perfectly to the little notches in the base, so you know it's secure. And power !!!! Fantastic takes less time to blend and pulverize my fruit, fresh spinach. ground flaxseed, a dollop of yogurt, a tablespoon of honey and protein powder. This baby ROCKS !!!! No regrets on this purchase !!! Update: After three months of daily use, I must say this is by far THE MOST SUPERIOR DESIGN FOR A BLENDER. Look no further- this one does what it says, no leaks, no mess, and PERFECT every time. Five stars !!
customer_reviews.author: Whidbey Retiree

customer_reviews.title: It's in perfect condition but the motor is dead
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating. I bought this item in May 2017 and used it about 10 times and it no longer works at all. It's in perfect condition but the motor is dead.
customer_reviews.author: Constance M LaValle

customer_reviews.title: Won't be using it again... I think is going to end up catching on fire
customer_reviews.text: Got this product December 2017 I barely used it but since I got it, it leaves black stuff on the counter and its really hard to wipe off. Today I used it for longer than usual and the black stain was a lot bigger than the size of the Ninja and it went crazy and would not stop spinning... Won't be using it again, it freaked me out and the black rubber smell and the stains are not going away, just getting worse. Anyways I thought it was normal, but I got my bf one a couple months ago and his does not do this...
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: After blended a drink bottom of the blender leaves black marks or dirts on ur table.
customer_reviews.text: Hi there I just got this item from you and it’s working fine. But there is small issue every time when I blended some drinks underneath of blender came out black color dirts and hard to clean it I don’t know what that was but looks like came out from blender cooling hole Could you explain to me what it was ? I had to put a fabric under.
customer_reviews.author: Erfate A

customer_reviews.title: Not that much better than the less expensive bullet
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a failing bullet believing I was getting a far greater unit in both performance and durability. From the first use this unit leaks and didn't perform significantly better than the less expensive bullet. I will keep it but was not as happy with the results as I was hoping for. Additionally, as others have pointed out the base of this unit is very hard to remove when hot liquids are being blended. My wife uses this for Bullet coffee every day. She is very strong and still needs me to open this up for her occasionally. Since it is so hard to remove the fact that it still leaks is a mystery...
customer_reviews.author: Warrior3735

customer_reviews.title: but it is really super easy to use and practical for quick breakfast shakes
customer_reviews.text: Very much still learning about this product, but it is really super easy to use and practical for quick breakfast shakes. Last night my Hunny made salad with romaine, arugula, radish, scallion, EVOO and a touch of sesame oil. Half he put on a plate the other half went into the mixing cup a small amount of good chicken broth was added because of the need for liquid; and pulsed a few times. We both drank the end product, it was good and would be good for anyone who has trouble chewing or swallowing. Like after dental procedures, etc. We will keep experimenting, you are most limited only by your imagination or lack of it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Rain

customer_reviews.title: A Mighty Blender In A Mini Package
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the complaint that it is "manual". It is so powerful that your pressure on the vessel is only for seconds to get a perfect smoothie or blended soup. I also own the larger Ninja Professional BL660 blender in another location and can attest to the fact that while this Nutri Ninja Pro is less powerful, for it's compact size and single blade design it is still a winner. While you don't have the variability of the larger Ninja's multi-speed controls, IMHO a lot of that stuff is really overkill anyway. Highly recommended for smaller venues or for single folks where the larger Ninja is not appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: DonP

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading the customer reviews I thought I would be at least semi satisfied but unfortunately that was not the case. I have had the nutri bullet but after 5 years the system begins to deteriorate (the motor unit). Considering the this unit has a four year warranty I'm assuming that this one will be too. This ninja blender is way too loud and it does not grind the food as well as the nurti bullet. I will be giving this blender away and just order some other blender what a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Coli

customer_reviews.title: Pulverizes my greens in smoothies.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for RV travel (after CR recommendation and viewers’ comments), makes great slushy and smoothie drinks. While not as powerful as home Vitamix, pulverizes greens with fruit and powders much finer than Oster personal blender that failed...pretty close to Vitamix IF I follow guidelines. My only quibble is the gasket is not easy to remove for cleaning. I found a flat-bladed cuticle pusher works ok; although finding replacement gaskets online isn’t easy. I assume this tool may potentially cause early gasket failure. I would like to see them include a removel tool. The cups are very nicely made and lids substantial. The measuring increments are appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Mumsers

customer_reviews.title: Overall easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is easy to use and I do almost everyday, but you do have to be vigilant about soaking any particularly viscous smoothie ingredients off and you may need s special tool (sponge/brush) to clean seal nook of the blade cap. The lids with spouts also require some soaking so that all particles are removed from the threads of the seal. However the motor itself is very strong and cuts through ice and frozen fruit no problem. Would recommend purchasing more cups and perhaps and additional blade if you are going to use everyday.
customer_reviews.author: MJH

customer_reviews.title: Great blender... but LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: This blender is the best small blender I've used. I use mine to make blended coffees every morning (yes, I know its a lot of sugar). This blender has plenty of power, maybe too much, and doesn't struggle at all. However, it is LOUD. This blender is hard to talk over from two rooms away in my house. This will wake up everybody else in the house if they aren't already up. I'm not sure if it's because of how I'm using it, nothing has seemed to make much of a difference. It's a great blender, but be aware of the noise if you plan to use it early in the morning with others trying to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Klopfenstein

customer_reviews.title: Choose your ninja wisely or waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a ninja for $120 bucks but the smoothie cups are only 18 ounces and I can’t find a bigger size that fits this #%*!!! So bought a ninja smoothie maker 22 ounce, 24 ounce, 28 once, and 32 oz cups this Model has a much wider selection! Yeah, But now I have two ninja motors in my kitchen now :( also bought the cheaper ninja smoothie maker for around 35 bucks but the plastic is so damn thin just turning will make the plastic crack. But I bought this machine years ago learned my lesson!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie S

customer_reviews.title: Cup fails to fit after one dishwasher wash
customer_reviews.text: The cup says dishwasher safe in manual, but after one dishwasher wash, it never fits the knife lid again--totally useless now. Called customer service, waited 40 min before somebody answer the call. They are not taking the responsibility, and wanted to charge me 15 bucks to replace a cup. Very disappointed on the quality of product and service. Not considering buying any more product from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Jin

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I thought I wouldn't like it more than my old NutriBullet, but I was surprised that I liked it better. I like that you have to hold down the cup for the unit to operate, since I feel it is safer because you can control the blade action. Also, you don't have to worry about a locking mechanism. With the NutriBullet the locking mechanism was always jamming. I didn't give it a 5 star rating because the unit was advertised as "Like New" and the base as well as the cup came with obvious scratches.
customer_reviews.author: gypsypixie

customer_reviews.title: O-Ring is hard to clean and it gets filthy.
customer_reviews.text: I love the power and ease of use. However, there is an O-Ring that keeps the bottom blade portion of the screwable lid tightly sealed during the mixing process begins to emit rotten food odor after a few uses. I think this O-Ring seal design can potentially become a cause of food contamination and the manufacturer should review the design to improve the hygiene of the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Hyuun

customer_reviews.title: Can't open
customer_reviews.text: I make a protein shake with frozen fruit for breakfast most mornings. I purchased the Nutri Ninja because it has a powerful motor and you can blend and drink from the same cup. The problem is you can't get the blades off of the cup after blending. The blade lid creates a suction to the cup so strong that it won't budge. The suction lessens after 15-20 minutes and I can get it off but by that time I usually have had something else. I would not recommend this blender to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ox

customer_reviews.title: Blender throws electric sparks from the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Received the item last week and it throws electric sparks from the bottom when in action. If you leave a white clothes underneath then it covers it with black residue. I have just tried it once and it seems not safe at all. Thanks to amazon's Great customer service, I got full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I heard so many great gongs about the ninja so when I accidentally dropped my nutribullet and it broke, I decided to get the ninja. I drink a fruit kale smoothie a few days a week and it does not blend anywhere near the nutribullet. I definitely should’ve stuck with what I know because now I have a blender I don’t wanna use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor build
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item back in April 26th 2018 and it died on me on the 1st of June 2018. I tried several times to get it to start by plugging it in another outlet and that failed. Nothing worked and the warranty after reading the fine print is useless since you have to send it back with your own money in order for them to send one back to you or repair it. Not worth my time. I spent 50 dollars and now that has gone down the drain. Not sure how this has such high stars with such poor quality
customer_reviews.author: ernest

customer_reviews.title: GREAT smoothie maker!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine, first I kept having problems with it leaking. I read all the reviews and comments and realized that I was tightening it too much which causes the seal to compress too much. I now tighten it only slightly and haven't had any problem with it leaking. I also find it is not hard to clean, as soon as I have made a smoothie I just run water over the blade unit and this way I don't have to take the seal out every time I use it. Very impressed with the power of this machine. I would definitely recommend the Shark Ninja!
customer_reviews.author: funshine

customer_reviews.title: Crushes ice in seconds! Its a beast!
customer_reviews.text: For a 'small' single serve blender, this blender is a beast! I have used other brands in the past and have been 'happy' with them but I didn't realize what I was missing! Other blenders would take several minutes, or cycles, to blend all my ice (for smoothies). I would inevitably ALWAYS end up with little chunks of ice left! This blender not only crushes every single piece of ice but does it in a few seconds! Super simple to use, just a one handed press, no twisting, turning, etc of the cup, just easy!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: This is very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I will mainly be using this unit to grind wheat with. I have in the past used a different product for grinding my wheat berries. It worked well but has worn out. Since I only need a cup or two at a time it was working well for me. It was only 250 watts. This time I decided to give this Ninja unit a try. It is large and is a powerful 900 watt unit. It was finished grinding my wheat very quickly. I will use this for smoothies and shakes as well, but my main focus was for the wheat. Great product, great price and received very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Valrose

customer_reviews.title: Does the job perfectly
customer_reviews.text: It is a no-nonsense blender with a strong motor that is to the point and does the job perfectly. It looks good, is the right size, has a certain heftiness to it, has the minimum required accessories and no more (which is a good thing), and is well-priced. The only issue is that it is loud. But then you won't need to keep it running for long because it crushes all your fruits and veggies almost instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Roshan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible blender
customer_reviews.text: Returned it after two uses. The 24 oz cup is more like a 18 oz cup because the blade takes up a quarter of the cup, I could barely fit two fruits in it and still would have a hard time closing it afterwards! Also hated having to push down the cup for it to start, would prefer a button. Also the fruits would get stuck in the cup and would not go down to the blade no matter how hard I tried for them to go down. Returned it and got a Ninja professional 1000W blender with 72 oz pitcher, much happier!
customer_reviews.author: Honest Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this about a month now and I am very pleased. It's louder than my old, cheap smoothie maker, but I guess that's just what you get when you get a decent smoothie maker. I just warn everyone before I make my smoothies, so I don't freak them out. The cats have finally stopped running from the kitchen when it goes off. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Little powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. I have a vitamix blender which is huge and I don't ever use it. This Ninja blender does what a large blender like the vitamix blender can do. Clean up just as easy rinse and put soap and water into it run through a blending cycle and WAH LAH its clean. The base was a bit larger than I expected. I thought it would look like the bullet. However after I read the reviews of the bullet and say that it didn't blend vegatables to a smoothie consistency it makes sense the base is a bit larger. To house a more powerful motor. Its worth it. You won't be sorry
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Powerful solution to the vegetable problem
customer_reviews.text: Smoothies make vegetables palatable. Just mix them with other stuff like bananas, apples and ice, and you can drink just about anything. You don't need recipes. Make up your own. It all works. This 900 watt blender chops through ice and course foods powerfully and quickly. The two sizes of cups is useful. The large works for single-portion food blends. The smaller works for the wife's coffee-milk mixtures. Having the chopping blades in the lid keeps the device safe from accidents. Cleaning is easy. Rinse cup, whir with a little soapy water, rinse again. I use this thing every day now. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: H Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Blends powerfully, just what you'd want for a chunk-less smoothie
customer_reviews.text: never blended before, easy to use and clean, have had no problems and blends very well. I am extraordinarily picky about chunks of any size in my drinks, so i needed a powerful blender, and even though I strain my smoothie after every time (because I am ocd about it) the only bits ever caught in the strainer are seeds, so it does a great job blending anything in there to pure liquid.
customer_reviews.author: april Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy beginner blender
customer_reviews.text: I love my ninja. I started on smoothies with this blender. It can blend ice and any frozen solid fruits or veggies. I add a liquid to every smoothie. I've also made guacamole with no liquid and it turned out great. It's really simple to use and you can wash every piece that comes into contact with the food. I love it. Also the lids make a great added bonus as you can drink right out of them and secure them so they dont leak.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: dont buy if you already have a blender.
customer_reviews.text: i still get fruit stuck on the blades and pieces of pulp or fiber (cranberries and pineaple is what i consume more) its just like a regular blender, nothing special i does not do what you see on the tv ad. no it wont "disolve" fruit nor seeds nor nuts... i still find it practical as a travel blender (i am a contractor so im away from home all the time) but definitely not what you see on tv.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Zavala

customer_reviews.title: Great machine (would be better if quieter)
customer_reviews.text: Still WAAAAY too loud and struggles a bit with pulpy veggies like fresh ginger root, but it gets the job done. I'm no expert but I feel that the blade placement is the biggest problem. Still...minor quibbles. And now that it's around 60 dollars it's a great value. Oh...and the cups are very much improved over older models.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic blender
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this blender, and the two sizes of cups with lids. I made a shake at a friends house with their magic bullet blender and intended on buying that because it's all I knew but I'm glad I got this one instead. The blender is more powerful and the cups are far superior, I also like the 2 different sized depending on what I'm making.
customer_reviews.author: ~Astro~

customer_reviews.title: Started Making Noises, Now Smoking - Time for the Trash Can
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine with light use for a couple years, so I'll give it credit for that. Recently it started making slightly terrifying noises that changed pitch and volume depending on the ease or difficulty of what it was chopping. Started to worry it would explode while I was using it. Nope. But it started smelling kinda funny while it worked. Didn't feel hot to the touch, but today it started smoking while I was trying to use it. All done, off to the trash thank you. Time to find another brand, which is a bummer because I had purchased extra cups and lids and stuff, and now all of that is trash too. :/
customer_reviews.author: A. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but does so loudly
customer_reviews.text: The Ninja BL456 is probably overkill for what I use it for: making protein shakes and smoothies. The blender is plenty powerful, but there are some tradeoffs. First, the unit is larger than I expected; it's nearly twice the size of a typical bullet-type blender. Make sure you have enough room on your counter or in your cabinet for storage. Next, the motor runs very loudly. Lastly, since you need to hold the cup down to keep the blades turning, you can't avoid hearing it the whole time. On the positive side, the Ninja does a nice job of blending and clean up is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let its size fool you...it’s powerful!!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little unit! I realized I mistakingly purchased whole flaxseeds instead of ground. Dreading having to pull out all the bits and bobs to my Cuisinart just to milk these seeds, I looked over at the Ninja blender on the counter. Why not? I piped the seeds into the smallest jar and pushed to blend. And after about 20 seconds, I had ground flaxseeds! So simple and minimal cleanup...and no having to hassle with the big food processor! Awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: VonWong

customer_reviews.title: Great for making healthy smoothies
customer_reviews.text: Works infinitely better than a blender and is uber-fast in pulverizing fruits and vegetables. Easy to clean in the dishwasher but make sure you handle the blades carefully - they are very sharp. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: dauba

customer_reviews.title: Love it except for the recipe book
customer_reviews.text: After one week of use, we love this Nutri Ninja Pro. The one we bought came with a larger and smaller cup. The grinding action is fabulous and frozen fruits are no obstacle for it. The recipes in the included book are pretty yuck but we've been making up our own recipes. For example Pina Colada: Frozen pineapple, organic coconut milk, lime juice, and bananas. Delish!
customer_reviews.author: Paula H.

customer_reviews.title: I use this for literally everything
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of cooking but being a small household I don't do large volume cooking and this is perfect for a 1-2 person household. Whether its blending portions of soup for texture, or making fast pancake batter. I don't make smoothies but I have no doubt that this could get the job done. A solid option.
customer_reviews.author: MLavore

customer_reviews.title: Smoothie Machine
customer_reviews.text: I own a Blendtec Blender and can make great smoothies with it but was looking for something a little more convenient. I was skeptical on whether this would work as well as the Blendtec but was pleasantly surprised. Now no more cleaning out the blender and glass since I can make a single serving and drink right out of the container.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to a Nutribullet.
customer_reviews.text: From the way that my sister had glowed about Ninja blenders, I had expected this to be like a cheap Vitamix and pound everything to smithereens. Eh, not so much. It does a reasonably good job on smoothies, but the things that are traditionally blender-challenging, like hard vegetables (raw carrots and beets), berries (all those seeds), etc. are still not going to get to the point that the texture is totally unnoticeable. This gets them to a very similar texture as my two previous Nutribullets did, and seems similar in durability – will last for a year or two of daily use. For the price, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Owens

customer_reviews.title: attracts mold!!
customer_reviews.text: I clean the blade assembly meticulously after each use, including removing the oring every few uses, AND THERE IS STILL MOLD AND GUNK PERMANENTLY AFFIXED TO THE ORING. seriously avoid this thing. Someone please tell me of a blender that doesnt have mold issues
customer_reviews.author: Jason S

customer_reviews.title: Loud! But does the trick.
customer_reviews.text: Super loud, but does the trick. I'm embarrassed to make shakes in the morning for fear that I'll wake up my neighbors in my apartment building (I'm not exaggerating, it's loud). But I really enjoy the single serve aspect of this blender and how fast it blends my smoothies. Read many reviews about not over-filling to avoid leaking, and I haven't had problems since I'm conscious of not over-filling. Oh yeah, did I mention it's super loud? You've been warned.
customer_reviews.author: DKuti

customer_reviews.title: A standard in our home
customer_reviews.text: This is our second unit. First one lasted about five years before the motor went. Main thing to keep your unit running longer is A) use sufficient liquids B) don't run the unit longer than like 15-20 seconds at a time. The more you run any kind of motor as hot and long the shorter it's life. We use it for many things from floats, smoothies, drink mixes, etc. I prefer this style to any other 'blender'.
customer_reviews.author: inayat2012 on youtube

customer_reviews.title: I've converted to a "Ninja blender sexual" love this machine.
customer_reviews.text: Frozen strawberries, blueberries or blackberries no problem! I've never had to blend for more than 10 seconds TOPS for a total puree! Love love love love love Love love love love love Love love love love love (ect ect) this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Bremer

customer_reviews.title: Blends well. But have to hold down cup to keep it blending.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for our smoothies. It takes a little more strength to operate than normal. You have to press down hard on the cup to activate the blender. It doesn’t lock to the base, and the base has no buttons of any kind. You just place the cup in the base, then press down hard to turn it on. You have to keep pressing as long as you want it to keep blending.
customer_reviews.author: Sean J.

customer_reviews.title: Blender is fantastic / Box arrived damaged though.
customer_reviews.text: When I first receive it, I had to check it out in the mail office, box was so damage that I thought the blender as well. I honestly love this ninja, is very user friendly and super practical for me. Im an athlete so I like everything fast and this is the greatest blender I had so far. However, make sure your wrapping is better or eventually you will experience loses and refunds with other customers. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 2 years and very loud
customer_reviews.text: Very loud, to the point where people in the same room as me would want warning so they could leave every time I used it. Have to cover my ears with my shoulder when I turn it on everyday or I’m sure I’d have hearing damage. Also, it broke after 2 years. Every Ninja bullet I’ve purchased breaks in 2 years. It’s worth dishing out an extra $100 to get a better blender than this that will last. Oh and if you accidentally don’t screw the blade on tight enough you’ll have smoothie all inside the motor part that you’ll never be able to clean off completely.
customer_reviews.author: Frances S.

customer_reviews.title: Nutra-bullet on the Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best blender you can buy online. For less than 100$ you get more than everything you need in a personal or shared blender. Two size cups provide ample room for any sort of concoction. I use primarily for protein shakes and smoothies, but also to blend cashews to make creamy sauces. you get a set of big blades the blender itself and even a recipe booklet in the box. It blends incredibly well, incredibly fast, and feels like a well-engineered machine, as well as looking great ontop of the counter. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Rashba

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size of container, easy to use and clean but less powerful
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small size blender and found this one. The bigger bottle is good for one family and the smaller one is perfect for a morning to-go smoothie. Very easy to use and more importantly super easy to clean!! But I guess as a trade off, the power is not as strong as vitamix, it took longer than I expected to fully blend the fruits and the texture isn’t as silky as the stronger blender. So if you really want a silky texture you may need a blender which is more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Kungfu Panda

customer_reviews.title: stop working after 37 days now I have to pay to ship a new motor
customer_reviews.text: I have had my ninja for 37 days. At day 30 it quit working. I called and they walked me through a troubleshooting. It worked that day and hasn't worked since. I called tonight and found out I have to pay for shipping a new motor. I told them I shouldn't have to pay anything. He said if you don't, I can't ship you a new motor. Really! I even bought the extended warranty but that isn't any good until after one year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: YES YES YES why did I not get this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I honestly do not know why I did not get this sooner. Last year I got on a morning smoothie kick and have a normal ninja which I love, but it was such a hassle cleaning out every morning for just one smoothie. This is fab! I make my smoothie and then rinse off the blade and pop the travel lid on and I am out the door to work LOVE LOVE LOVE. Purchase this and you will not regret it. (I blend fresh and frozen fruits and spinach and it purées beautifully)
customer_reviews.author: Kate Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Didn't want to love but I do!
customer_reviews.text: After my NutriBullet quit on me, I had to quickly find a replacement. I originally wanted to buy the same model since I loved the blender so much, but couldn't swallow the cost. After looking around, I found this Ninja that is comparable and almost half the price. It's louder than I expected, but works WAY better and I love the lid accessories I didn't have before. I would definitely recommend this if you're on a budget, but don't want to skimp on quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but at first it worked fine, and now I have to play around with ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't figure out how to contact seller, but at first it worked fine, and now I have to play around with it to get it to work. I press down and nothing happens. This has been going on for the past couple days and I have only had this for a couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: A group of smoothie addicts got together & designed a winning combination of machine and cups.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had purchased the Ninja before the other two blenders that have died on me in 2 years. It shreds frozen fruit, raw spinach, oats & ice instantly. The wide mouth cups are genius (why aren't all companies making smoothie cups like this?). The design makes them so much easier to clean. Seems like a group of smoothie addicts got together and designed a winning combination of machine and cups. Thanks! *I'd love to purchase an extra blade thing if anyone has any information on that. RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Aida Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Smoothies every morning!
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying the Ninja, even my husband is on board. We have experimented with lots of fruit/veggie combos. I have a smoothie every morning. The Ninja is powerful and truly "smooths" everything from spinach to ice. I've never had a lump of anything in my smoothie. The fill line is and absolute. Don't go over the line and you will not have any problems with leakage. Love it. It was definitely a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: MoRee

customer_reviews.title: ITS LOUD and the bearings fail too fast.
customer_reviews.text: Its a powerful machine. It works! But it's unbelievable how loud it is and it gets worse with time. I work in a industrial plant I understand loud machines but this at this point of 2 years unacceptable. The bearings are on their way to fail and for the money in a twice a day use within the instructions guidelines use its not acceptable for this to go to fail so fast. I will replace it but it will not be a Ninja. Hope this helps others to decide.
customer_reviews.author: james l. taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this blender about 4 months and it works really great. Super easy to use and clean. The cups are very portable and fit both my small car’s cup holders as well as the one on my our truck. I would absolutely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Ninja means quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ultimate morning smoothie blender! I’m blown away by the power and quality! Even the blades, blending cups, lids, etc are very thick and robust. This is a great deal and I love it! Keep in mind this is best for smoothies or smaller jobs like soups or salsas. This isn’t a large volume blender for cooking. The biggest cup is only 24 ounces.
customer_reviews.author: John Wolk

customer_reviews.title: That one was great for someone who wants something basic and temporary (but ...
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful. I used to have the Bella rocket blender that is listed here on Amazon for around $18-20. That one was great for someone who wants something basic and temporary (but still better than a Hamilton Beach blender). This is a lot more powerful and will probably last a lot longer too. Depends on what you're looking for and your budget. I lost the Bella blender because I moved and had to leave stuff behind, but I'm happy I ordered this one this time because it is far more suitable for the leafy greens of a green smoothie. The Bella would definitely have struggled with that, this one doesn't. Cheers to a healthier lifestyle!
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Best blender I have ever had and great for one person.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t put the blender part on very tight, I only fill to the fill line, and I found a tool to get the grommet out to clean(this was the hardest part). It has been a fantastic blender. I’ve had some dental work done so for a while I can’t chew anything and this allows me a variety of choices. I love that all you have to do is press down to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Ingalls

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy everything about our Ninja Blender except the silly gasket. I thought I could get away with removing and cleaning the *rubber gasket* after every 2-3 uses but that ended up being a gross idea. SO - I highly recommend removing and cleaning the gasket after every use; however, I have to carefully remove it with the use of a super skinny paring knife. If you do not clean it each time you will then come to enjoy MOLD. Eww! Other than this small extra effort I have zero complaints. It's powerful, quick and takes up little space.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but works well.......broke
customer_reviews.text: Great blender, I use it almost every day for smoothies. It’s a little loud and I was disappointed that I have to keep pushing down on the container for blending. I don’t care for that but prefer this over the Magic Bullet. I was also disappointed that it was on sale a few days after I purchased it and Amazon would not give me a price adjustment. Rude! Update.....ordered May 2018, motor burned out today December 21 2018. Used on average of once daily for smoothies. I think it should last longer than 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean!
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender! My favorite feature is that you can made a smoothie, take off the bottom piece, screw on the top that comes with it, and take it with you. With other blenders, you'd have to pour it into a separate container and then have both the blender and the separate container to clean. Also, I was surprised by how powerful it is given that it's fairly small. It cuts through ice better than my previous blenders which were much larger. My kids have been making a ton of smoothies ever since I bought this blender!
customer_reviews.author: mom of three

customer_reviews.title: No access to clean gasket!? on the blade piece. Starting to smell
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this on May 11th and I'm already having the same problem as I see in a review below with the smell or oder in the blade piece. I was everything after every single use and leave them out to dry completely. Now I've noticed the smell. I will try to figure out pulling out the gasket and check for mold but I can't use it in this condition. I'm afraid to get sick. Is there anything I can use to clean the internal area that is nearly impossible to reach?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best blinders I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I don't completely understand why people are complaining about the noise level of this blender. When you have 900 w of power, it's suppose to make noise, especially when you throw ice and nuts in it. This blender is as advertised. Performance is great, looks are great, and so far the durability is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Mason

customer_reviews.title: I put in frozen fruits and it shreds them good! Not related to the product but
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful! And exretemely loud my floor shakes. It works thought. I use to to make smoothies. I put in frozen fruits and it shreds them good! Not related to the product but... Originally I bought this and there was some issue of it being delivered and it was suppose to be re delivered but then got lost somewhere.... Not sure if USPS stole this or lost it. I had to reorder a new one. So it basically took a week to receive this. When it was suppose to be 2 day prime.
customer_reviews.author: Sealed With a Kiss J.

customer_reviews.title: Rip off
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but cheap. It’s loud as hell, you have to hold the top for it to blend, the blades are dull so it doesn’t have good blending power... can barley blend ice. I threw away the box or I would have returned this piece of crap. I wouldn’t recommend it especially for the price. Rip off
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: For My Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender for my dogs. I have two geriatric dogs that can no longer chew and eat their kibble. I was smashing their kibble inside a paper lunch bag with a cooking utensil at every mealtime. Now, I just pour the proper amount into the cup, twist on the top which has the blades attached, click into little machine and press down. I add some water and let it sit for a minute.....and I have their perfect mushy meal. Super simple to use and wash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets it Done!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful, also noisy, but still gave it 5 stars because it gets the job done! I like the 2 sizes of containers, and the lids are really nice. You can make a shake, put the lid on, add a straw, and off you go with breakfast! I have the full size Ninja and use it all the time for things like soups, especially gazpacho, but really needed a smaller one too. We had a Magic Bullet, but it stopped working after a year of so. Hoping this will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S

customer_reviews.title: Love this blender & cups set!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Press down 2 or 3 times and its all blended! Cups hold more than enough and I can snap the lid closed, refrigerate and drink troughout the day if I choose. Well made powerful blender and sturdy cups. Recommend 100% for smoothies! And it will do much, much more that I haven’t tried yet. Also, people have written that it is loud. All my blenders/mixers are loud so I can’t tell a difference. And it is certainly not bothersome when you just press it down a few times and your blending is done ✅
customer_reviews.author: marty sosa

customer_reviews.title: Best blender I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: Best blender I've owned. I don't like counter clutter as well as huge blenders. Super easy to use and clean. Every blender is going to have a silicone seal or O ring to stop leaking. You have to remove it and wash it periodically, but you should do that with anything dealing with liquid you ingest. I hand wash the blade piece with every use and remove the silicone seal about once a week to clean. As other reviews have mentioned, dont overfill and you'll have no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Tran

customer_reviews.title: Powerful blender with a few kinks
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! We bought a magic bullet and it was horrible. Bought this and it’s amazing. Great power, nice big containers, easy to clean the blades, cups, and the lids. A little hard to open the lids and the blade drips when you take it off. Wish it had a component for it to blend hands free, but other than that very very pleased. Excellent for price also.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Spend a bit more on higher wattage
customer_reviews.text: Like this but think I should have gotten a higher wattage for a bit more as it doesn’t totally blend carrots. Also a ball of ingredients remains at very bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Z

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but loud
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy with the purchase. We make daily smoothies and shakes in our house and had lived with the $20 mini-blenders that last about a year. I decided to spend more and upgrade. This thing is crazy powerful and does the job in 10-15 seconds. It would get 5 stars if it was a little quieter.
customer_reviews.author: TRS

customer_reviews.title: Maintenance of the product
customer_reviews.text: When you are finding a blender for keepers, this isn't the product. Getting spare parts of the product is extremely expensive!! the blade replacement on its website costs **60%** of the actual product itself!!!! If you cannot provide affordable assistance for a product after warranty, you are practically expecting customers to buy the product again after an year's warranty is over. RIP OFF!!
customer_reviews.author: Prabhav Pathak

customer_reviews.title: It works fantastic. No complaints with the overall product
customer_reviews.text: It works fantastic. No complaints with the overall product. However I didn’t leave 5 stars because the way it was shipped. For whatever reason the seller didn’t put it in a box and chose to ship it in the actual ninja box. Like slapped the shipping label on the actual box and it sat on my step until Someone got home. That’s a problem. Definitely something someone would not hesitate to walk up and grab. And more importantly it was a mother’s day gift that was ruined because she ended up knowing the gift before me. (She called to tell me a blender had came & was on the step when she pulled up 🙄)
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great for Smoothies
customer_reviews.text: I use this solely to make smoothies and I make them every day. I've had other blenders before and what I really like about this one is the large cups that come standard. The blender does a great job and makes quick work of the smoothie. It's loud, but that's to be expected with a blender.
customer_reviews.author: James Harpole

customer_reviews.title: Who built it like that?
customer_reviews.text: This is the hardest thing to clean. The rubber needs cleaning!! Who built it like that?
customer_reviews.author: Monique Samuels

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This motor is strong. I’m used to using the 1500 watt ninja and I feel this spins just as fast. The cups that comes with it are much wider as well. The trade off of course is the versatility of having multiple mixing attachments. But I mainly do smoothies anyways so this is perfect. Clean up is always a breeze. I usually just do a quick rinse
customer_reviews.author: Vetyaz

customer_reviews.title: Fast, quiet, blends everything I've thrown at it.
customer_reviews.text: Blends EVERYTHING! Fast, quieter than my normal size blender, and the travel cups are AWESOME for quick morning smoothie blend and go. The recipe book has some nice tasting options too, always nice to try a different mix. UPDATE: One month in and this continues to impress. I will have to look into their bigger versions so the missus and I can both use it in the morning! I've blended carrots, spinach, and other leafy greens without issue using very little water or juice in my smoothies.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin V.

customer_reviews.title: Good blender with a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: The personal ninja blender is very good at breaking down ingredients and incorporating everything together, but it has a few flaws. The rubber gasket isn't perfectly snug against the blender top, so you'll have to clean it each time you use it unless you like having old, decomposing food in there. You'll need to fish it out using a thin object. Also, having to continuously hold down the blender to make it run is a little annoying. It'd be great if you could press down and turn to lock it in place, but it's not a terrible inconvenience if you're blending is quick.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Han

customer_reviews.title: Smoothie greatness
customer_reviews.text: Bought to have a travel blender for my smoothies and it works perfectly for what I need. I don't use ice or frozen fruit so can't say on its tougher chopping but I've had four a few months now and still working great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Renee

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, noisy, hard to clean the gasket
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought a Powerful blender like this early on. Making smoothies and nut milk by this blender is wonderful. But its design is a downside. Try to pull the gasket out and observe what left behind then you'll understand why. So please make sure you clean the lid without the gasket every single use for all our sakes. Plus, the machine is a little noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Chi Vu

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for about 9 months and in that time one of the plastic cups got scrapped up and had to be replaced. Recently, the plastic on the blade part has cracked, rendering it unusable, less I want to risk smoothie leaking and spraying out. It appears to not be covered under warranty, either. Would not recommend unless you are okay with replacing multiple parts a year.
customer_reviews.author: Malery Williams

customer_reviews.title: I bought this ninja but i am disappointed due to it is really loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ninja but i am disappointed due to it is really loud. and the motor start by itself when i barely im placing the glass on it. scary and wake up most of my family for an early smoothy. not worth it. I could returned since i actually bought it so i can travel with it. in the location that i am right now it will take like to months to return when the policy said return within a month. so i won't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!!!
customer_reviews.text: The price is right and it works beautifully. I order one for my son immediately after opening and making my first calorie free fresh lime and ice smoothie. It's summer time and the blended ice with fresh fruit or coffee is so refreshing. My son is going to be thrilled!!!
customer_reviews.author: yd

customer_reviews.title: Great blender!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product. I use it daily for smoothies and it’s been great. Blends ice and frozen fruits well. It can get be a little difficult to clean, I normally rinse and wash the cup immediately after use to make sure there is not stickiness. I also take a paper towel and run it in between the seals to clean out the juice that seeps in there. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Strong blender, works as advertised. I like it's simple function and quick blend ability. I use it to make smoothies and pulverize cooked / steamed vegetables to create a sauce to "disappear "in food so my toddler doesn't refuse to eat because she sees an icky bit of carrot or other vegetable. The size of the blender and blending cups is prefect for my family of two adults and a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Groggee

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. No really. We have a Vitamix blender and unless you are making a huge batch of something the Ninja beats it hands down. My teenage daughter makes her own smoothies all of the time. It takes maybe 30 seconds to blend a frozen fruit based smoothie. I put a top on the cup and I am out of the door and headed to work. If you drink smoothies as part of your diet I highly recommend this blender.
customer_reviews.author: OCRSpartan

customer_reviews.title: GREATEST + SMALLEST blender ever
customer_reviews.text: LOVVVVEEE IT!!! I use it no joke every.day For my protein shakes and almost 1 year later still going strong , highly recommend P.S : anyone saying it ‘over flows’ - you can’t fill it to the max with liquid , because if your adding powder, ice, condiments, etc. it will have more mass- therefore OVERFLOW. Use common sense.
customer_reviews.author: tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Major health hazard | please avoid
customer_reviews.text: The machine works fine but has rust and oil leakage issue. On top of it, It makes extremely loud noise which can make you go mad. But the worst is the rust and other leakages which contaminates your food. I am now back in market to buy a new one after one year of usage. Complete waste of money!! Please avoid!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a large Ninja blender with attachments but wanted to downsize due to having a very small kitchen. After reading and reviewing I decided to stick with Ninja since the last one worked so well. This thing delivers - powerful, small, great for smoothies or dressings. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!  So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been dragging out the blender for smoothies - this product is small and easy to keep on the counter. I just throw in fruits and juice and blend! I freeze cubes of fruit and it blends both the frozen fruit as well as ice easily. I love it! Easy to use, easy to clean and very powerful!
customer_reviews.author: Catgetsdown

customer_reviews.title: Push down, blend easy
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy, just give it a downward push, make sure there is enough liquid per solid and it blends with no problem. I've blended fruit smoothies to protein powders and meal replacement powders with all kinds of frozen to fresh fruit with ease. Super simple to clean and I use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but noisy.
customer_reviews.text: It works great buy I put ear plugs in when I use it. Other than the noise I have no complaints. I did find that the short cup that comes with it make a lot less noise the the taller on does when mixing. I would be totally happy if it were not for the noise it makes!
customer_reviews.author: Blake S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Protein shake blender!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I were using the blender that came with Isogenix for the past year and have gone through 2 of them. I received this Ninja yesterday and we have used it 4 times now and this thing is awesome! It literally takes 15 seconds to blend our shakes! I can’t wait to make some smoothies with this. We also like that out comes with a 18oz and 24oz cups with mouthpiece caps. The size of the machine is not huge, but it’s also more compact.
customer_reviews.author: michael de bolt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect single sized blender
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender. Every once in awhile it starts to get stuck when blending and is hard to remove the cup but otherwise it’s awesome. Perfect amount of smoothie and comes with several pieces to help and let you make several smoothies. Improvement from old model.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

product_meta.title: Ninja Nutri Pro Compact Personal Blender, with 18 Oz. and 24 Oz. To Go Cups, in a Black and Silver Finish
product_meta.description:
The Nutri Ninja Pro provides you with powerful nutrient & Vitamin extraction performance to extract hidden nutrition from whole fruits and veggies. 900 watts of professional power breaks down fruits and vegetables for nutrient rich juices on the go. Ninja Pro Extractor blades crush through ice, seeds, skins and stems for a smooth, even consistency. Twist on the Sip & seal lids and take your drinks with you. All parts are BPA free and dishwasher safe. (Extract a drink containing vitamins and nutrients from whole fruits and vegetables> by blending whole fruits and vegetables, including portions that are normally discarded). You may also wash the jars by filling the jar to the Max Fill line with warm water and a drop of dish washing detergent, placing the blade assembly on the jar and pulsing a few times. Do not fill the jar more than the Max Fill line with water because it will overflow. Once clean, remove the jar from the motor base. Rinse the jar, attachment and lid under running water. Allow all the parts to dry before storing.

BRAND STORY
By Ninja
feature_bullets: 900 watts of professional power breaks down fruits and vegetables for nutritious juices and smoothies
The nutri ninja: Pro provides you with powerful nutrient & vitamin extraction performance to extract hidden nutrition from whole fruits and veggies
Twist on the spout lids and take your drinks with you for easy on the go sipping
Manually pulse to easily crush ice, seeds, skins, stems and frozen ingredients for a smooth, even consistency
All parts are BPA free and dishwasher safe

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,737 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
